sentences.sentence: When the old priest( 神父 ) saw him coming, in his shepherd( 牧羊人 )’s clothes, he looked shocked( 震惊的 ).
He stood up and went to the young King, and said to him, “Is this how a King should dress?
And what crown( 王冠 ) should I place on your head, and what scepter( 权杖 ) should I place in your hand?
Surely this should be a happy day for you, and not a day of humiliation( 耻辱 ).”
“Should Joy( 快乐 ) wear clothes that are made of grief( 悲伤 )?” asked the young King.
And then he told the priest( 神父 ) his three dreams.
When the priest( 神父 ) heard them he looked worried, and said, “My son, I am an old man.
In my long life, I have seen that many cruel( 残忍的 ) things are done in the world.
Men kill one another, and die from( 死于 ) disease( 疾病 ).
The strong steal from the weak, and make them into slaves( 奴隶 ).
Beggars( 乞丐 ) have nothing to eat, and live on the streets with dogs.
Can you do anything to stop these things? Will you go and care for the sick, and feed( 给...食物 ) the beggars( 乞丐 )?
Will you stop men from killing one another, and protect the weak from the strong? Can you stop this suffering( 苦难 ), which God himself made when he created the world?
I beg( 恳求 ) you, go back to the palace, put on your fine clothes, and be happy.
I will put your crown( 王冠 ) on your head, and place your scepter( 权杖 ) in your hand, and you will be the King.
And as for your dreams, do not think any more of them.
There is too much suffering( 苦难 ) and too much sorrow( 悲伤 ) in this world for one man’s heart to suffer( 承受 ).”
“What would He think of what you have just said?” said the young King, and he looked toward the image of Jesus Christ.
The young King walked past the old priest( 神父 ), and went over to the image of Christ.
And then he got on his knees, lowered his head, and prayed( 祈祷 ).
Suddenly the street outside became very noisy, and the officials( 官员 ) entered the cathedral( 大教堂 ) with their swords( 宝剑 ) in their hands.
“Where is this dreamer of dreams?” they shouted.
“Where is this King who is dressed like a beggar( 乞丐 )? Where is the boy who brings shame upon our kingdom?
We will kill him, because he does not deserve( 配得上 ) to rule over us.”
The young King bowed( 低下 ) his head again, and prayed( 祈祷 ).
When he had finished his prayer( 祷告 ) he stood up, and turning around he looked at them sadly.
Through the windows of the cathedral( 大教堂 ), the sunlight came down and shone on him.
And the sunlight covered him, and became a golden robe( 礼袍 ), more beautiful than the robe( 礼袍 ) which had been made for his coronation( 加冕 ).
Roses grew from his crown( 王冠 ) of thorns( 荆棘 ), and they were redder than rubies( 红宝石 ).
White lilies( 百合花 ) covered his shepherd( 牧羊人 )’s staff( 拐杖 ), and they were whiter than pearls( 珍珠 ).
The leaves of the roses were made of shining gold, and the leaves of the lilies( 百合花 ) were made of bright silver.
The people fell on their knees in awe( 敬畏 ), and the officials( 官员 ) put down their swords( 宝剑 ) and bowed( 行礼 ).
The old priest( 神父 )’s face grew pale, and his hands shook.
“God himself has given you your crown( 王冠 ),” he cried, and he dropped to his knees in front of the young King.
The young King came forward from the image of Jesus Christ, and walked home among his people.
But no man dared( 敢于 ) to look at his face, because it was like the face of an angel( 天使 ).

article_info.previous: 国王穿着旧衣服，戴着树枝做的王冠便去参加加冕礼。路人都以为这是国王的弄臣，纷纷嘲笑他。负责守卫大教堂的士兵也没认出国王，所以不让他进去。

question.cn: 按神父的建议，国王应该做什么？
question.en: On the priest's advice, what should the King do?

options.cn: 返回王宫，穿上漂亮的衣服并且高兴点儿。
options.en: Go back to the palace, put on the fine clothes, and be happy.
Stop thinking about his dreams.
Both of them.

analysis: 由原文可知，神父对国王说：“I beg you, go back to the palace, put on your fine clothes, and be happy. And as for your dreams, do not think any more of them. There is too much suffering and too much sorrow in this world for one man’s heart to suffer.”因此本题选C。

question.cn: 为什么官员们想杀掉国王？
question.en: Why did the officials want to kill the King?

options.cn: 因为国王只是个小孩子。
options.en: Because the King was only a child.

options.cn: 因为他们认为国王给国家带来了耻辱。
options.en: Because they thought the King brought shame upon the country.
Because the King was ugly and selfish.

analysis: 文中提到：“Where is this King who is dressed like a beggar? Where is the boy who brings shame upon our kingdom? We will kill him, because he does not deserve to rule over us.”因此本题选B。

question.cn: 国王站起来转过身后发生了什么？
question.en: What happened when the King stood up and turned around?

options.en: He was killed by the soldiers.
He was like an angel.
He cried sadly.

analysis: 国王站起来转过身之后，金色阳光洒在他身上，鲜花从他头顶的树枝长出。“The young King came forward from the image of Jesus Christ, and walked home among his people. But no man dared to look at his face, because it was like the face of an angel.”因此本题选B。

question.cn: 在《快乐王子》的故事中，为什么市长说雕像没有用处？
question.en: In the story of Happy Prince, why did the Town Mayor say that the statue was not useful?

options.en: He was afraid that people might think he was unpractical.
He disliked the Happy Prince.

options.cn: 他想要把快乐王子的雕像换成自己的。
options.en: He wanted to replace it with the statue of himself.

analysis:
文中提到：“ ‘He is as beautiful as a church bell,’ said the Town Mayor, who wanted to impress people with his fine artistic taste. ‘But he is not quite so useful,’ he added, 
because he was afraid that people might not think he was practical, when in fact he was.”因此本题选A。

question.cn: 在故事《快乐王子》中，为什么快乐王子这么悲伤？
question.en: In the story of Happy Prince, why was the Happy Prince so sad?

options.en: Because he cannot move.

options.cn: 因为他看到很多人在遭受痛苦。
options.en: Because he saw many people suffering.

options.cn: 因为他想回到自己的皇宫。
options.en: Because he wished to go back to his palace.

analysis: 文中快乐王子说道：“And now that I am dead, they have put me up here so high that I can see all the ugliness and all the sadness of my city. Even though my heart is made of iron, I cannot stop myself from crying.”因此本题选B。

question.cn: 在《快乐王子》的故事中，为什么快乐王子失明了？
question.en: In the story of Happy Prince, why was the Happy Prince blind?

options.cn: 因为他把眼睛给了穷人。
options.en: Because he gave his eyes to the poor.

options.cn: 因为他不想看到这个丑恶的世界。
options.en: Because he didn't want to see the ugly world.

options.cn: 因为他想把眼睛送给燕子作为礼物。
options.en: Because he wanted to give them to the Swallow as a gift.

analysis: 从文中可知，快乐王子把用宝石做成的眼睛都送给穷人，最后自己变瞎了，因此本题选A。

question.cn: 在第二个故事中男学生为什么会哭泣？
question.en: In the second story, what was the Student worried about?

options.cn: 他无法完成学校的作业。
options.en: He could not finish his schoolwork.

options.cn: 他无法找到一朵红玫瑰。
options.en: He could not find a red rose.

options.cn: 他不能参加王后的舞会。
options.en: He could not attend the Queen's Ball.

analysis: 文中提到：“ ‘Not one red rose in my entire garden!’ he said again, and the tears began to run down his face.”因此本题选B。

question.cn: 在第二个故事中，对夜莺来说，最重要的东西是什么？
question.en: In the second story, what was the most important thing to the Nightingale?

options.en: Love.
Life.
Death.

analysis: 文中夜莺说：“Still, I am certain that love is a wonderful thing. It is more precious than sapphires, and dearer than fine rubies.”因此本题选A。

question.cn: 在《公主的生日》这个故事中，公主平时可以跟朋友们玩耍吗？
question.en: In the story: The Birthday of the Infanta, could the Infanta play with her friends during ordinary days?

options.en: Yes, she could.
No, she couldn’t.
We don’t know.

analysis: 文中提到：“The little Princess herself walked through the garden with her friends, and played hide and seek around the trees and the old statues. On ordinary days she was only allowed to play with other princes and princesses, and so she very often had to play alone. ”因此本题选B。

question.cn: 在故事《公主的生日》中，矮人为什么会死去？
question.en: In the story: The Birthday of the Infanta, why did the Dwarf die?

options.cn: 他终于知道他很丑，公主不可能会喜欢他。
options.en: He finally knew that he was ugly and the Princess would never love him.

options.cn: 他知道公主给他玫瑰只是出于礼貌。
options.en: He knew that the Princess was only being polite to give him the rose.

options.cn: 他知道他没有机会再见到公主了
options.en: He knew he did not have the chance to see the Princess again.

analysis: 联系上下文，矮人一直以为公主对他笑送他玫瑰都是因为喜欢他，甚至幻想和公主幸福快乐地生活在一起。当看清镜子里的自己后，他猛然明白真相，所有的笑都是嘲笑。公主也不可能喜欢这么丑陋的自己。因此本题选A。

question.cn: 在故事《星孩》中，谁把小孩带回了家？
question.en: In the story: The Star-Child, who took the child home?

options.en: The wolf.
The King.
The Woodcutter.

analysis: 文中提到：“So he picked up the child very gently, held it in his coat to protect it from the cold, and went back to the village.”因此本题选C。

question.cn: 在故事《星孩》中，为什么星孩想找到他的母亲？
question.en: In the story: The Star-Child, why did the Star-Child want to find his mother?

options.cn: 因为他变丑了，后悔对母亲如此粗暴无礼。
options.en: Because he became ugly and he regretted being rude to his mother.

options.cn: 因为他知道自己是国王的儿子。
options.en: Because he knew he was the King's son.

options.cn: 因为他很善良很爱他的母亲。
options.en: Because he was kind and loved his mother so much.

analysis: 文中星孩说：“Surely this has happened to me as punishment, because I have driven my mother away, and been too proud, and cruel to her. Therefore, I will wander over the whole world searching for her, and will not rest until I find her.”因此本题选A。

question.cn: 在故事《星孩》中，星孩是怎么找到金子的？
question.en: In the story: The Star-Child, how did the Star-Child find the gold?

options.en: God helped him.
The rabbit helped him.
The beggar helped him.

analysis: 文中提到：“He was filled with joy, and took it, and said to the Rabbit, ‘You have repaid me several times over for saving you, and I owe you many thanks.’ ‘No,’ answered the Rabbit, ‘I just did what I could to help you, because you helped me.’ ”可知本题选B。

question.cn: 在故事《少年国王》中，为什么国王拒绝穿上他珍贵的礼袍？
question.en: In the story: The Young King, why did the King refuse to wear his precious robe?

options.en: He preferred his old clothes.
He didn't like the color of it.

options.cn: 他明白有人因为制作礼袍而丧生。
options.en: He understood that men had died for making the robe.

analysis: 文中可知，国王的三个梦暗示他的珍贵礼袍的背后是人民的血汗，国王不能接受这样的残酷剥削，于是选择穿回旧衣服，因此本题选C。

question.cn: 在故事《少年国王》中，国王的三个梦是关于什么的？
question.en: In the story: The Young King, what were the King's three dreams about?

options.en: His magnificent coronation.

options.cn: 人们为他提供精美物品的努力。
options.en: People's efforts for providing him the beautiful things.
Children were dying of hunger.

analysis: 综合上下文可知，国王梦到人们因为制作这些精美的物品生活贫苦甚至丧命，因此本题选B。
